intro: Diplectria papuana, commonly known as the Papuan diplectria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
